cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SE of the mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Moving NNW, forecast to turn north then NNE and track parallel to, then inland along, the south-central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Texas coastline, roughly between Corpus Christi and Port O’Connor

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to Port Aransas, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to High Island, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire south and central Texas coastline, including adjacent bays and barrier islands
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (17% chance of ≥34 kt) Monday morning through evening; sustained winds likely below 50 kt threshold.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible at the mouth of the Rio Grande and adjacent lower Texas coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain possible with isolated higher totals, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous rip currents are possible Monday.
